intro: Ephedra gerardiana var. wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan ephedra, is a shrub native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its jointed, woody stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are typically pollinated by wind. Its stems contain ephedrine, a compound historically used in traditional medicine. This species is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
